alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:29AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dubois and northwestern Perry Counties through 1015 AM EDT/915 AM CDT/... At 928 AM EDT/828 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Lynnville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Perry and southwestern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Duff, Adyeville, Ferdinand, Huntingburg Airport, Millersport, Huntingburg, Saint Henry, Johnsburg and Holland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/ for south central Indiana.
